title: The best games of the year for experts
summary: The game’s new “Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft” graphics engine is more lifelike than ever, and all of its core mechanics have been retooled to make them smoother and more intuitive. God of War is everything an expert gamer could want in a game. The game uses a special graphics technology called “real-time photogrammetry” to render lifelikes visuals that look almost like 3D renders. Mario Tennis Aces has one of the best-looking graphics engines of any tennis simulation game.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Hearthstone"),mdx("p",null,`Hearthstone is one of the most popular collectible card games of all time, and this year it got a major makeover. The game\u2019s new \u201CHearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft\u201D graphics engine is more lifelike than ever, and all of its core mechanics have been retooled to make them smoother and more intuitive.
The result is a game that expert CCG gamers can\u2019t get enough of. They praise Hearthstone\u2019s variety of playstyles and card types, as well as its deep and challenging \u201Cladder\u201D multiplayer mode. What\u2019s more, the game\u2019s new graphics engine serves up expertly rendered visuals that are so lifelike, you can almost smell the dust on the cards.`),mdx("h2",null,"Dark Souls: Remastered"),mdx("p",null,"Dark Souls is one of the most challenging games ever made, and this remastered version is even harder. But if you\u2019re an expert gamer, that\u2019s a good thing. Dark Souls experts love the game\u2019s punishing difficulty and incredibly demanding \u201Csoftcore\u201D multiplayer mode. They also appreciate the game\u2019s updated graphics engine, which is more visually impressive than ever thanks to modern rendering techniques and better texture resolution."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re a masochistic expert gamer, check out this remastered version of the infamous Dark Souls to experience one of the most challenging expert games on the market."),mdx("h2",null,"Mario Tennis Aces"),mdx("p",null,"Mario Tennis Aces is an expert-friendly tennis simulation, with a few notable gameplay variations. First, the game has a \u201Cspecial shots\u201D mechanic that lets players unleash supercharged tennis shots with a well-placed button tap. Second, the game has a \u201Cscoreboard\u201D mode where two players compete to take out as many tennis balls as possible in a limited time. Both of these variations make the game more challenging and fun, and they make it accessible to both experts and casual gamers alike."),mdx("p",null,"Moreover, Mario Tennis Aces has one of the best-looking graphics engines of any tennis simulation game. It uses a special graphics technology called \u201Creal-time photogrammetry\u201D to render lifelike visuals that look almost like 3D renders. That makes this game a one-of-a-kind expert-friendly experience."),mdx("h2",null,"God of War"),mdx("p",null,`God of War is one of the most highly anticipated expert games of the past few years, and it delivers on every expectation. This action-adventure game has a compact but challenging campaign, gorgeous lifelike visuals, and a unique combat system that\u2019s both visceral and strategic.
In short, God of War is everything an expert gamer could want in a game. It has a rewarding narrative, challenging boss fights, and a \u201Cspecial attacks\u201D mechanic that lets players use the environment to their advantage.`),mdx("p",null,"What\u2019s more, the game\u2019s new engine has some of the best lighting effects we\u2019ve ever seen. It makes the game\u2019s lush environments even more lifelike and immersive than ever before."),mdx("h2",null,"Shadow of the Colossus"),mdx("p",null,`This action-adventure expert game is one of the most visually stunning games ever made, and it\u2019s even more impressive now that it\u2019s been remastered. The game uses a special \u201CBluepoint Engine\u201D to render lifelike visuals that are almost photorealistic in some cases.
This engine also makes the game\u2019s expansive and immersive environments look more realistic than ever before, which is perfect for an expert-friendly game like Shadow of the Colossus.`),mdx("p",null,"To top it off, this remastered version of the game has smoother animations, an enhanced artificial intelligence for enemies, and a more intuitive control scheme for button inputs."),mdx("h2",null,"Marvel's Spider-Man"),mdx("p",null,`This action-adventure expert game has a lot going for it. It has an open-world map that\u2019s as large and immersive as any expert gamer could want. It also has a challenging campaign, smooth and intuitive controls, and a special \u201Cspider sense\u201D mechanic that lets you dodge attacks with ease.
And on top of all that, this game has incredible visuals that are some of the best we\u2019ve ever seen. The game uses a special \u201CInsomniac Engine\u201D to render lifelike photorealistic visuals with an almost uncanny level of detail.`),mdx("h2",null,"Red Dead Redemption II"),mdx("p",null,`Red Dead Redemption II is one of the most anticipated expert games of the decade, and it\u2019s finally here. This open-world expert game is crammed with content, including expansive sandbox maps and a robust multiplayer mode. It also has a unique \u201CDead Eye\u201D targeting system and a \u201Crules of the wild\u201D mechanic that lets you influence the game world in surprising ways.
It even has lifelike visuals, thanks to NVIDIA RTX ray-tracing technology that makes light bend and bounce properly in a way that\u2019s never been seen before. And if all of that isn\u2019t enough for you, this game also has a \u201Cfirst-person\u201D mode that lets you experience it from a whole new perspective.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,`As you can see from this list, there are plenty of expert-level games out there. And while they might not be as accessible as the casual games you\u2019re used to, they\u2019re certainly worth the extra effort. After all, expert games are designed to challenge you in new and interesting ways. They\u2019re meant to push you out of your comfort zone and make you a better gamer in the process.
And while some of these games have been out since the start of the year, others are brand-new releases that give expert gamers a whole new world of challenges and excitement.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The 5 Most Underrated Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Video games have become a big part of our culture. Millions of people around the world play video games every day, and some even make it their career. In 2018 alone, over 200 new video games were released. It\u2019s important to keep tabs on all the new releases so you don\u2019t miss out on anything great. That being said, there are a lot of video games that aren\u2019t receiving the attention they deserve for various reasons.
Did you know that the average video game player is getting older? According to recent data, the average age of video gamers is now 35 years old! That means most gaming enthusiasts probably won\u2019t find as many underrated games as they would have when they were younger. However, there are still plenty of underrated gems out there that are well worth checking out this year! Here are the top 5 underrated video games of 2018:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Worst Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The video game industry is filled with great games. These are also some of the most challenging and difficult ones to make. Cracking the code on how to build a well-crafted and engaging video game requires practice, ingenuity, skill, and patience. But not every developer is up to the task. Some simply fail at creating an entertaining experience for players. This list compiles some of the disappointments from 2018 that failed to meet an acceptable standard of quality.
These are the worst games of 2018, broken down by category and listed in no particular order. Some might have had good intentions or interesting concepts, but fell short in their execution. If you\u2019re looking for something new to play this year, stay away from these titles as they won\u2019t give you your money\u2019s worth or much satisfaction beyond finishing them once (if that).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Everyone

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re interested in video games, you have probably heard that 2018 was a great year for gaming. It was. But it wasn\u2019t just this past year\u2014gaming has been on the upswing for a while now. There are more gamers playing more games than ever before, and it\u2019s an exciting time to be part of this culture.
There are so many excellent video games released every month that it can be overwhelming to keep track of them all. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled a list of what we think are the best new games from the last few months of 2018 that everyone should play if they get the opportunity:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Adults
The Best and Worst Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It takes a lot of great games to make a great year. In 2018, we saw new entries in long-running series like Red Dead Redemption, Assassin\u2019s Creed, and Halo as well as brand new IP such as Monster Hunter: World, Into the Breach, and A Way Out. It was a year that saw game developers pushed by streaming services like Twitch and YouTube continue to experiment with new ideas and designs while also returning to their roots with older properties.
That being said, not all games are created equal. There are excellent games and then there are... others less so. To help you sort through the deluge of new releases this year, Gamers Central has compiled a list of our top ten favorite titles coupled with an even longer list of disappointments that you may want to avoid entirely or at least wait for a sale before picking up.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Couples

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s the most wonderful time of the year. From binge-watching Christmas TV specials to baking gingerbread cookies and sipping hot cocoa, there are plenty of ways to get into the holiday spirit. And what better way to keep that good cheer going than by playing a game with your significant other?
With so many different board games available on the market, it can be challenging to figure out which ones are worth investing in. Thankfully, this list features some of the best games perfect for couples this holiday season. Whether you\u2019re looking for a light-hearted romp or an intense challenge that brings you closer as partners, these games have you covered.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Families

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Word games, puzzles, board games, card games and video games. Gaming is a wonderful way for families to connect and have fun together. Many parents worry that kids who play video games for long periods of time are not interacting with other people enough. But the truth is, there are lots of great family-friendly video games out there that can be an enjoyable part of your kid\u2019s life.
We present you with the best family-friendly games released in 2018: Word games, puzzles and board games. These are some of the most engaging titles we\u2019ve played all year long. These are not educational or just slightly wholesome\u2014these are the best family-friendly games released this year that we think everyone should own as soon as possible!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Anyone Who Wants to Have Fun
The Best Games of the Year for Solitaire Players

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are a million and one ways to play solitaire. The rules may be simple, but there is actually so much strategy involved that it\u2019s almost like learning a whole new game every time you sit down to play. If you enjoy playing solitaire games as much as we do, then you\u2019ll probably also agree that there are a lot of different variations of the game itself as well. Some versions of solitaire require skill, luck, and a little bit of patience all at once.
These top rated games are some of the most fun and engaging ways to play this classic card game. Whether you prefer an easy version with higher rewards or something more strategic and challenging, these solitaire games will keep your interest from start to finish!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Partygoers
